main event: A UFO was sighted by four reliable observers in the Far East on April 8, 1961.
interesting points: The object was described as a round, dark white light that was brighter than a star, traveling very fast from west to east.
The object was observed for about 15 minutes through telescopes and binoculars.
The object appeared to move erratically and passed under the North Star, which the observers said it was much brighter than.
No sound was heard, and the object disappeared by fading into the background above the horizon, leaving no trail or exhaust.
Two of the observers had previously seen the Echo I satellite and stated that the UFO had a similar appearance and speed, but was brighter.
sighted object: a round, dark white light that was brighter than a star
